story_sentences.english: The old laws that once governed the realm were about to be <word id='_abolish' class='word-eng-link'>abolished</word>.
story_sentences.korean: 한때 왕국을 다스렸던 옛 법들은 이제 <word id='_abolish' class='word-target-kr'>폐지되려고</word> 했다.

story_sentences.english: An ancient <word id='_adage' class='word-eng-link'>adage</word> warned against hasty changes, but the new council ignored it.
story_sentences.korean: 오랜 <word id='_adage' class='word-target-kr'>속담</word>은 성급한 변화를 경고했지만, 새로운 의회는 이를 무시했다.

story_sentences.english: The city's <word id='_aesthetic' class='word-eng-link'>aesthetic</word> was transforming, reflecting a modern but sterile vision.
story_sentences.korean: 도시의 <word id='_aesthetic' class='word-target-kr'>미적인</word> 모습은 현대적이지만 무미건조한 비전을 반영하며 변화하고 있었다.

story_sentences.english: These changes would <word id='_affect' class='word-eng-link'>affect</word> everyone, from the highest noble to the humblest citizen.
story_sentences.korean: 이러한 변화는 가장 높은 귀족부터 가장 겸손한 시민에 이르기까지 모든 사람에게 <word id='_affect' class='word-target-kr'>영향을 미칠</word> 것이었다.

story_sentences.english: Some leaders decided to <word id='_affect_2' class='word-eng-link'>affect</word> an air of indifference, pretending not to care about the public's concerns.
story_sentences.korean: 일부 지도자들은 대중의 우려에 대해 신경 쓰지 않는 척, 무관심한 태도를 <word id='_affect_2' class='word-target-kr'>가장하기로</word> 했다.

story_sentences.english: Every minor <word id='_alteration' class='word-eng-link'>alteration</word> caused a ripple effect throughout society.
story_sentences.korean: 모든 사소한 <word id='_alteration' class='word-target-kr'>변경</word>은 사회 전반에 파급 효과를 일으켰다.

story_sentences.english: The lack of basic <word id='_amenity' class='word-eng-link'>amenity</word> for the common folk became a growing issue.
story_sentences.korean: 서민들을 위한 기본적인 <word id='_amenity' class='word-target-kr'>편의 시설</word>의 부족은 점차 커지는 문제가 되었다.

story_sentences.english: It was <word id='_approximately' class='word-eng-link'>approximately</word> dawn when the first protests began.
story_sentences.korean: 첫 시위가 시작되었을 때는 <word id='_approximately' class='word-target-kr'>대략</word> 새벽 무렵이었다.

story_sentences.english: Even the skilled <word id='_artisan' class='word-eng-link'>artisan</word> found it difficult to make a living under the new regulations.
story_sentences.korean: 숙련된 <word id='_artisan' class='word-target-kr'>장인</word>조차 새로운 규제 아래에서 생계를 유지하기 어려워했다.

story_sentences.english: They tried to <word id='_bear' class='word-eng-link'>bear</word> the weight of changes, hoping for a better future.
story_sentences.korean: 그들은 더 나은 미래를 희망하며 변화의 무게를 <word id='_bear' class='word-target-kr'>견디려고</word> 노력했다.

story_sentences.english: The merchants found it hard to <word id='_bear_2' class='word-eng-link'>bear</word> fruit from their labor.
story_sentences.korean: 상인들은 그들의 노동에서 결실을 <word id='_bear_2' class='word-target-kr'>맺기</word> 어려웠다.

story_sentences.english: The treasury could no longer <word id='_bear_3' class='word-eng-link'>bear</word> the burden of the lavish projects, leading to an economic downturn.
story_sentences.korean: 국고는 더 이상 호화로운 프로젝트의 부담을 <word id='_bear_3' class='word-target-kr'>감당할</word> 수 없었고, 이는 경제 침체로 이어졌다.

story_sentences.english: Despite the <word id='_bountiful' class='word-eng-link'>bountiful</word> harvests, the food distribution was unjust, leading to scarcity in some areas.
story_sentences.korean: <word id='_bountiful' class='word-target-kr'>풍부한</word> 수확에도 불구하고, 식량 분배는 불공평하여 일부 지역에서는 부족 사태가 발생했다.

story_sentences.english: People began to <word id='_dispute' class='word-eng-link'>dispute</word> the council's decisions openly in the streets.
story_sentences.korean: 사람들은 거리에서 공공연히 의회의 결정에 <word id='_dispute' class='word-target-kr'>논쟁하기</word> 시작했다.

story_sentences.english: This widespread <word id='_dispute_2' class='word-eng-link'>dispute</word> threatened to plunge the nation into chaos.
story_sentences.korean: 이러한 광범위한 <word id='_dispute_2' class='word-target-kr'>논쟁</word>은 국가를 혼란에 빠뜨릴 위협이 되었다.

story_sentences.english: The future of the kingdom became <word id='_dubious' class='word-eng-link'>dubious</word>, clouded by uncertainty.
story_sentences.korean: 왕국의 미래는 불확실성으로 뒤덮여 <word id='_dubious' class='word-target-kr'>의심스러워졌다</word>.

story_sentences.english: Their natural <word id='_faculty' class='word-eng-link'>faculty</word> for adaptation was severely tested.
story_sentences.korean: 적응을 위한 그들의 타고난 <word id='_faculty' class='word-target-kr'>능력</word>이 혹독하게 시험받았다.

story_sentences.english: In every <word id='_field' class='word-eng-link'>field</word> of society, discontent was growing.
story_sentences.korean: 사회의 모든 <word id='_field' class='word-target-kr'>분야</word>에서 불만이 커지고 있었다.

story_sentences.english: Yet, the common folk remained <word id='_guiltless' class='word-eng-link'>guiltless</word> of any wrongdoing, simply trying to survive.
story_sentences.korean: 그러나 서민들은 어떤 잘못도 <word id='_guiltless' class='word-target-kr'>결백한</word> 채, 그저 생존하려 애썼다.

story_sentences.english: An <word id='_influx' class='word-eng-link'>influx</word> of refugees from the struggling regions began to arrive in the capital.
story_sentences.korean: 어려움을 겪는 지역에서 수도로 <word id='_influx' class='word-target-kr'>유입</word>되는 난민들이 도착하기 시작했다.

story_sentences.english: The capital city's resources threatened to <word id='_inundate' class='word-eng-link'>inundate</word> under the sheer number of newcomers.
story_sentences.korean: 수도 도시의 자원은 엄청난 수의 신참자들로 인해 <word id='_inundate' class='word-target-kr'>감당할 수 없을</word> 정도가 될 위협에 처했다.

story_sentences.english: The council tried to <word id='_lure' class='word-eng-link'>lure</word> people back to the countryside with promises of land.
story_sentences.korean: 의회는 토지를 약속하며 사람들을 시골로 다시 <word id='_lure' class='word-target-kr'>유혹하려</word> 했다.

story_sentences.english: The pressure on the city to <word id='_mount' class='word-eng-link'>mount</word> relief efforts quickly became immense.
story_sentences.korean: 도시가 구호 활동을 <word id='_mount' class='word-target-kr'>시작해야</word> 하는 압력은 빠르게 엄청나졌다.

story_sentences.english: The demands for change continued to <word id='_mount_2' class='word-eng-link'>mount</word> with each passing day.
story_sentences.korean: 변화를 요구하는 목소리는 날마다 계속 <word id='_mount_2' class='word-target-kr'>증가했다</word>.

story_sentences.english: Life for many citizens had become increasingly <word id='_mundane' class='word-eng-link'>mundane</word> and bleak.
story_sentences.korean: 많은 시민들에게 삶은 점점 더 <word id='_mundane' class='word-target-kr'>평범하고</word> 암울해졌다.

story_sentences.english: A small rebel group managed to <word id='_outstrip' class='word-eng-link'>outstrip</word> the royal guard in a daring raid.
story_sentences.korean: 작은 반군 단체는 대담한 습격에서 왕실 경비대를 <word id='_outstrip' class='word-target-kr'>능가하는</word> 데 성공했다.

story_sentences.english: Their actions were highly <word id='_pertinent' class='word-eng-link'>pertinent</word> to the growing unrest among the populace.
story_sentences.korean: 그들의 행동은 대중들 사이에서 커지는 불안과 매우 <word id='_pertinent' class='word-target-kr'>관련이 있었다</word>.

story_sentences.english: To <word id='_preclude' class='word-eng-link'>preclude</word> further violence, a general strike was announced.
story_sentences.korean: 더 이상의 폭력을 <word id='_preclude' class='word-target-kr'>막기 위해</word> 총파업이 선언되었다.

story_sentences.english: The people vowed to <word id='_refrain' class='word-eng-link'>refrain</word> from work until their demands were met.
story_sentences.korean: 사람들은 그들의 요구가 충족될 때까지 일하는 것을 <word id='_refrain' class='word-target-kr'>중단하겠다고</word> 맹세했다.

story_sentences.english: The number of participants was <word id='_roughly' class='word-eng-link'>roughly</word> estimated to be in the tens of thousands.
story_sentences.korean: 참가자의 수는 <word id='_roughly' class='word-target-kr'>대략</word> 수만 명으로 추정되었다.

story_sentences.english: The protest had the <word id='_semblance' class='word-eng-link'>semblance</word> of a chaotic festival, yet an underlying tension was palpable.
story_sentences.korean: 시위는 혼란스러운 축제의 <word id='_semblance' class='word-target-kr'>외관</word>을 가지고 있었지만, 내재된 긴장감은 분명히 느껴졌다.

story_sentences.english: There was a strange <word id='_semblance_2' class='word-eng-link'>semblance</word> between the current unrest and the revolution of old.
story_sentences.korean: 현재의 불안과 옛 혁명 사이에는 이상한 <word id='_semblance_2' class='word-target-kr'>유사성</word>이 있었다.

story_sentences.english: The council members, with their <word id='_sophisticated' class='word-eng-link'>sophisticated</word> arguments, tried to calm the masses.
story_sentences.korean: <word id='_sophisticated' class='word-target-kr'>복잡한</word> 논리를 가진 의회 의원들은 대중을 진정시키려 노력했다.

story_sentences.english: This marked a new <word id='_stage' class='word-eng-link'>stage</word> in the kingdom's history, a turning point.
story_sentences.korean: 이는 왕국 역사상 새로운 <word id='_stage' class='word-target-kr'>단계</word>이자 전환점이었다.

story_sentences.english: The atmosphere in the city grew <word id='_thick' class='word-eng-link'>thick</word> with anticipation and fear.
story_sentences.korean: 도시의 분위기는 기대와 두려움으로 <word id='_thick' class='word-target-kr'>빽빽해졌다</word>.

story_sentences.english: <word id='_thus' class='word-eng-link'>Thus</word>, the king was forced to address the people directly.
story_sentences.korean: <word id='_thus' class='word-target-kr'>따라서</word> 왕은 직접 백성들에게 연설해야만 했다.

story_sentences.english: Even a <word id='_tiny' class='word-eng-link'>tiny</word> concession from the crown could have changed the tide.
story_sentences.korean: 왕실의 <word id='_tiny' class='word-target-kr'>작은</word> 양보라도 흐름을 바꿀 수 있었을 것이다.

story_sentences.english: However, the king's rule was seen as increasingly <word id='_tyrannical' class='word-eng-link'>tyrannical</word> by the populace.
story_sentences.korean: 하지만 왕의 통치는 백성들에게 점점 더 <word id='_tyrannical' class='word-target-kr'>독재적</word>이라고 여겨졌다.

story_sentences.english: The kingdom was on the <word id='_verge' class='word-eng-link'>verge</word> of open rebellion.
story_sentences.korean: 왕국은 공공연한 반란의 <word id='_verge' class='word-target-kr'>경계</word>에 있었다.

story_sentences.english: Meanwhile, an old <word id='_acquaintance' class='word-eng-link'>acquaintance</word> of the king secretly planned his own move.
story_sentences.korean: 한편, 왕의 오랜 <word id='_acquaintance' class='word-target-kr'>지인</word>은 은밀히 자신만의 계획을 세웠다.

story_sentences.english: He sought to <word id='_acquire' class='word-eng-link'>acquire</word> enough support to challenge the throne himself.
story_sentences.korean: 그는 왕좌에 도전할 충분한 지지를 <word id='_acquire' class='word-target-kr'>얻으려</word> 했다.

story_sentences.english: His <word id='_affection' class='word-eng-link'>affection</word> for the kingdom was genuine, but his methods were questionable.
story_sentences.korean: 왕국에 대한 그의 <word id='_affection' class='word-target-kr'>애정</word>은 진심이었지만, 그의 방법은 의심스러웠다.

story_sentences.english: Many nobles began to <word id='_agree' class='word-eng-link'>agree</word> with his secret proposals.
story_sentences.korean: 많은 귀족들이 그의 은밀한 제안에 <word id='_agree' class='word-target-kr'>동의하기</word> 시작했다.

story_sentences.english: The royal guards were kept on <word id='_alert' class='word-eng-link'>alert</word> due to the rising tensions.
story_sentences.korean: 왕실 경비병들은 고조되는 긴장 때문에 <word id='_alert' class='word-target-kr'>경계</word> 태세를 유지했다.

story_sentences.english: The usurper's charisma began to <word id='_allure' class='word-eng-link'>allure</word> the disenchanted populace.
story_sentences.korean: 찬탈자의 카리스마는 불만을 품은 대중을 <word id='_allure' class='word-target-kr'>유혹하기</word> 시작했다.

story_sentences.english: His speeches would <word id='_amplify' class='word-eng-link'>amplify</word> their hopes and grievances.
story_sentences.korean: 그의 연설은 그들의 희망과 불만을 <word id='_amplify' class='word-target-kr'>증폭시켰다</word>.

story_sentences.english: The king's reign, once fertile, was becoming as <word id='_arid' class='word-eng-link'>arid</word> as a desert.
story_sentences.korean: 한때 비옥했던 왕의 통치는 사막처럼 <word id='_arid' class='word-target-kr'>메마르고</word> 있었다.

story_sentences.english: People began to <word id='_ascribe' class='word-eng-link'>ascribe</word> all their misfortunes to the current monarchy.
story_sentences.korean: 사람들은 모든 불행을 현 군주제에 <word id='_ascribe' class='word-target-kr'>돌리기</word> 시작했다.

story_sentences.english: The rebel leader promised to <word id='_compensate' class='word-eng-link'>compensate</word> those who had suffered under the old regime.
story_sentences.korean: 반란군은 구 체제하에서 고통받았던 사람들에게 <word id='_compensate' class='word-target-kr'>보상하겠다고</word> 약속했다.

story_sentences.english: He planned to <word id='_configure' class='word-eng-link'>configure</word> a new system of governance.
story_sentences.korean: 그는 새로운 통치 체제를 <word id='_configure' class='word-target-kr'>구축할</word> 계획이었다.

story_sentences.english: The proposed changes were <word id='_drastic' class='word-eng-link'>drastic</word>, promising a complete overhaul of society.
story_sentences.korean: 제안된 변화는 사회의 완전한 개혁을 약속하는 <word id='_drastic' class='word-target-kr'>과격한</word> 것이었다.

story_sentences.english: The old guard tried to <word id='_embarrass' class='word-eng-link'>embarrass</word> the rebel leader with rumors, but it had little effect.
story_sentences.korean: 구세력은 소문으로 반란군 지도자를 <word id='_embarrass' class='word-target-kr'>당황하게</word> 하려 했지만, 효과는 미미했다.

story_sentences.english: His rise to power would <word id='_empower' class='word-eng-link'>empower</word> the common people like never before.
story_sentences.korean: 그의 권력 상승은 전례 없이 평민들에게 <word id='_empower' class='word-target-kr'>힘을 실어줄</word> 것이었다.

story_sentences.english: A secret <word id='_gathering' class='word-eng-link'>gathering</word> of loyalists plotted against the rebel leader.
story_sentences.korean: 충성파들의 비밀 <word id='_gathering' class='word-target-kr'>모임</word>은 반란군 지도자를 상대로 음모를 꾸몄다.

story_sentences.english: They aimed to <word id='_haul' class='word-eng-link'>haul</word> him down from his newfound popularity.
story_sentences.korean: 그들은 그의 새로 얻은 인기로부터 그를 <word id='_haul' class='word-target-kr'>끌어내리는</word> 것을 목표로 했다.

story_sentences.english: The threat was <word id='_immediate' class='word-eng-link'>immediate</word>, requiring swift action from the rebels.
story_sentences.korean: 위협은 <word id='_immediate' class='word-target-kr'>즉각적이었고</word>, 반군들의 신속한 조치가 필요했다.

story_sentences.english: The loyalists hoped their numbers would <word id='_increase' class='word-eng-link'>increase</word> with time.
story_sentences.korean: 충성파들은 시간이 지남에 따라 자신들의 수가 <word id='_increase' class='word-target-kr'>늘어나기를</word> 바랐다.

story_sentences.english: A shadow began to <word id='_loom' class='word-eng-link'>loom</word> over the rebel camp as the loyalists' plot unfolded.
story_sentences.korean: 충성파들의 음모가 전개되면서 반군 진영에 그림자가 <word id='_loom' class='word-eng-link'>어렴풋이 나타나기</word> 시작했다.

story_sentences.english: The rebel leader had to be careful not to <word id='_overtax' class='word-eng-link'>overtax</word> his resources.
story_sentences.korean: 반란군 지도자는 자신의 자원을 <word id='_overtax' class='word-target-kr'>지나치게 사용하지</word> 않도록 조심해야 했다.

story_sentences.english: It was a <word id='_paradox' class='word-eng-link'>paradox</word>: to gain control, he had to risk losing everything.
story_sentences.korean: 그것은 <word id='_paradox' class='word-target-kr'>모순</word>이었다: 통제권을 얻기 위해 그는 모든 것을 잃을 위험을 감수해야 했다.

story_sentences.english: The influence of the rebel leader was <word id='_pervasive' class='word-eng-link'>pervasive</word>, reaching every corner of the kingdom.
story_sentences.korean: 반란군 지도자의 영향력은 왕국의 모든 곳에 <word id='_pervasive' class='word-target-kr'>만연해 있었다</word>.

story_sentences.english: His message was <word id='_pleasing' class='word-eng-link'>pleasing</word> to the ears of the oppressed citizens.
story_sentences.korean: 그의 메시지는 억압받는 시민들의 귀에 <word id='_pleasing' class='word-target-kr'>마음에 들었다</word>.

story_sentences.english: The <word id='_primary' class='word-eng-link'>primary</word> goal was to establish a fair and just society.
story_sentences.korean: <word id='_primary' class='word-target-kr'>주된</word> 목표는 공정하고 정의로운 사회를 수립하는 것이었다.

story_sentences.english: He aimed to ensure every citizen received what was <word id='_proper' class='word-eng-link'>proper</word> for them.
story_sentences.korean: 그는 모든 시민이 그들에게 <word id='_proper' class='word-target-kr'>적절한</word> 것을 받도록 보장하는 것을 목표로 했다.

story_sentences.english: The loyalists planned to <word id='_retaliate' class='word-eng-link'>retaliate</word> swiftly against any rebel advancement.
story_sentences.korean: 충성파들은 어떤 반군 진격에도 신속하게 <word id='_retaliate' class='word-target-kr'>보복할</word> 계획이었다.

story_sentences.english: Their counter-attack would <word id='_serve' class='word-eng-link'>serve</word> as a warning to others.
story_sentences.korean: 그들의 반격은 다른 이들에게 경고로 <word id='_serve' class='word-target-kr'>작용할</word> 것이었다.

story_sentences.english: However, the rebel general was <word id='_shrewd' class='word-eng-link'>shrewd</word> and anticipated their moves.
story_sentences.korean: 하지만 반군 장군은 <word id='_shrewd' class='word-target-kr'>영리했고</word> 그들의 움직임을 예상했다.

story_sentences.english: He decided to <word id='_simulate' class='word-eng-link'>simulate</word> a retreat to draw them into a trap.
story_sentences.korean: 그는 그들을 함정으로 유인하기 위해 퇴각을 <word id='_simulate' class='word-eng-link'>가장하기로</word> 결정했다.

story_sentences.english: Not a single <word id='_speck' class='word-eng-link'>speck</word> of dust was left unturned in his meticulous planning.
story_sentences.korean: 그의 세심한 계획에는 <word id='_speck' class='word-target-kr'>한 점</word>의 먼지도 남기지 않았다.

story_sentences.english: He left no <word id='_speck_2' class='word-eng-link'>speck</word> of detail to chance, ensuring victory.
story_sentences.korean: 그는 <word id='_speck_2' class='word-target-kr'>조금의</word> 세부 사항도 우연에 맡기지 않아 승리를 확실히 했다.

stories.chapter_title: The Zenith of a New Era

story_sentences.english: The rebel army continued to <word id='_strive' class='word-eng-link'>strive</word> forward, driven by their cause.
story_sentences.korean: 반란군은 그들의 대의명분에 이끌려 계속 <word id='_strive' class='word-target-kr'>전진했다</word>.

story_sentences.english: One might <word id='_suppose' class='word-eng-link'>suppose</word> their morale was unbreakable.
story_sentences.korean: 그들의 사기가 꺾이지 않는다고 <word id='_suppose' class='word-target-kr'>가정할</word> 수도 있다.

story_sentences.english: Their swift victory came as a <word id='_surprise' class='word-eng-link'>surprise</word> to the complacent loyalists.
story_sentences.korean: 그들의 신속한 승리는 안일한 충성파들에게 <word id='_surprise' class='word-target-kr'>놀라움</word>으로 다가왔다.

story_sentences.english: The people decided to <word id='_treat' class='word-eng-link'>treat</word> the rebel leader as their liberator.
story_sentences.korean: 백성들은 반란군 지도자를 그들의 해방자로 <word id='_treat' class='word-target-kr'>대접하기로</word> 결정했다.

story_sentences.english: He was ready to <word id='_undertake' class='word-eng-link'>undertake</word> the immense responsibility of rebuilding the nation.
story_sentences.korean: 그는 나라를 재건하는 막대한 책임을 <word id='_undertake' class='word-target-kr'>떠맡을</word> 준비가 되어 있었다.

story_sentences.english: A new <word id='_variant' class='word-eng-link'>variant</word> of governance was about to be implemented.
story_sentences.korean: 새로운 형태의 통치 <word id='_variant' class='word-target-kr'>변형</word>이 시행될 참이었다.

story_sentences.english: The new kingdom reached its <word id='_zenith' class='word-eng-link'>zenith</word> under his benevolent rule.
story_sentences.korean: 새로운 왕국은 그의 자비로운 통치 아래 <word id='_zenith' class='word-target-kr'>정점</word>에 도달했다.
